FOSS United

FOSS United Remote Fellowship 2026

Remote stipend-backed fellowships to build and maintain FOSS projects in the Indian OSS ecosystem.

CompanyFOSS United
RoleFOSS Fellow
LocationRemote
Duration8–12 weeks
StipendExpected/Indicative: stipend per fellowship grant
Work HoursFull-time remote
Employment TypeIntern
ExperienceCoding background and OSS interest

Eligibility & Skills

  • Students or builders in India with OSS portfolios
  • Education: Open to students and professionals
  • Branches allowed: Computer Science, Information Technology, Electronics, Any with coding
  • Skills: Language fit to project, Git, Documentation
  • Year of study: UG/PG or recent grads
  • Age limit: Per program rules

FOSS United Remote Fellowship 2026

Introduction

FOSS United funds fellows to build and maintain open-source projects remotely. This guide covers eligibility, stipend expectations, and application steps (Expected/Indicative).

Program Overview

  • Remote development on FOSS projects
  • Mentor feedback from maintainers
  • Stipend per grant; deliverables with demos

Eligibility

  • OSS portfolio or active repos
  • Ability to work remote full-time during fellowship window

How to Apply

  1. Identify projects and mentors listed by FOSS United. 2) Submit proposal with milestones and links. 3) Undergo review and kickoff.

FAQs

  • Paid? Expected/Indicative: stipend per fellowship grant.
  • Remote? Yes.
  • Prior OSS? Strongly preferred; include links.

Ready to apply?

Applications close on 1 April 2026.
